alert.note: Alert for Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 10:43AM CDT until October 26 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Robertson county in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Calvert, Bremond, Twin Oak Reservoir, Lake Limestone, New Baden, Bald Prairie, Easterly and Seale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
